div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 30px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; font-weight: bold; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
div.div:
sends
submitHTMLForm()
with Email permission
from HTML-Website
via HTTP-POST

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
div.div:
Application Server
Doichain-dApp
(Send Mode)
REST /login
(params: authToken, userId)

div.div: Before Authentication: aquire userId and authToken from dApp by authenticating via standard username password on REST interface. (AuthToken and userID should safely stored)

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 256px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: we generate an in the Doichain blockchain public visible NameId by using the privKey of an ECDSA in uppercase letters. This privKey is not used for any cryptographic operations and only used as an publicly visible address in the Namecoin namespace "e/" manner. These namespaces are inherited from the Namecoin blockchain.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 180px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
we generate an ECDSA keypair
for creating a signature
of the recipient/sender permission.
(gets stored in the dApp-db)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
we create a signature from (sender_email+recipient_email)
with the privateKey of the recipient

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
we form a SHA256 datahash from the optional data given from the application server.
we want to proof its consistency
for later use e.g. in legal actions

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Gather the publicKey
of the responsible Doichain node for confirming and requesting the double-opt-in email from the TXT field of the DNS of the recipients domain. If not configured we use the public key of a official fallback node

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
with the gathered publicKey
we generate the Doichain address we'll send this data-entry a transaction (peer2eer via blockchain)

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: we ecies encrypt the URL of the Email template for the DOI-Request with the publickey of the recipient.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
name_doi is a RPC command of which inserts a value directly into Doichain.
we adapted former name_new, name_firstupdate, name_update,

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 11px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap; text-align: center;

div.div: stored in the local dApp db

switch.text: stored in the local dApp db

div.div:
Doichain Node
Listen for unconfirmend
incoming transactions

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 172px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Take our Doichain-Address in order to create the signature
from our name_id ("e/")
This signature will be used as query param in for requeseting the email template from Bob!
We make sure that only the authorized (Erika) can reqeust template and data for this name_id

display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 180px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div: Alice could be an internet user taking part in online promotion or registering for a newsletter on Bobs internet shop.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 210px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Bob could be a internet shop owner asking for permission to send promotion emails to Alice.
Bob could also be a sort of email marketing agency gathering valid, legal and DOI confirmed email addresses.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 83px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 276px; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;
div.div:
Erika is hosting the mail server (SMTP/POP3/IMAP4) of Alice and runs a Doichain Node+dApp in "Confirmation Mode" for sending out and confirming the incoming email permission requests ("doi's) in the blockchain.
In case Alice Mail-Provider didn't install Doichain yet Erika is a fallback node of Doichain.

div.style: display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; width: 85px; white-space: nowrap; word-wrap: normal; text-align: center;
display: inline-block; font-size: 26px; font-family: Helvetica; color: rgb(0, 0, 0); line-height: 1.2; vertical-align: top; white-space: nowrap;
div.div: Doichain UML-Activity v0.0.3 by Nico Krause, nico@doichain.org

switch.text: Doichain UML-Activity v0.0.3 by Nico Krause, nico@doichain.org
